description: Theoretical and physical limits for computing technologies

fundamental_physics_limits.description: Hard limits imposed by the laws of physics

practical_implications.notes: Minimum latency between components. Limits CPU clock speeds and distributed computing.

light_travel_per_ghz_cycle.notes: At 5 GHz, light travels only 6cm per clock cycle. This fundamentally limits how large a synchronous chip can be.

heisenberg_uncertainty.implication: Cannot measure energy precisely in arbitrarily short time
heisenberg_uncertainty.practical_impact: Limits minimum switching time and energy of transistors
heisenberg_uncertainty.notes: Quantum effects become dominant below ~5nm feature sizes

bekenstein_bound.description: Maximum information density in a physical system
bekenstein_bound.notes: Theoretical upper bound on storage density. Practical limits are many orders of magnitude lower.
bekenstein_bound.example: 1 liter sphere could theoretically store ~10^31 bits, but black hole would form

landauer_limit.description: Thermodynamic minimum energy to erase one bit of information at room temperature
landauer_limit.practical_gap: Current computing is ~1 million times above this limit
landauer_limit.notes: Applies to irreversible computation. Reversible computation could theoretically avoid this limit.

shot_noise_limit.implication: Limits minimum detectable signal in communications and sensors
shot_noise_limit.practical_impact: Affects analog computing, sensors, and high-speed communications

silicon_atomic_spacing.notes: Fundamental physical size of silicon crystal structure

gate_oxide_limit.limit_reason: Below this, quantum tunneling causes excessive leakage current

practical_silicon_limit.description: Practical lower bound for planar silicon transistors
practical_silicon_limit.notes: Quantum effects and variability dominate. GAA and nanosheets extend scaling.

current_production_2024.notes: Node names are marketing terms, not actual feature sizes

theoretical_limit_2d.notes: Approaching atomic scale. 3D stacking extends this further.

practical_limit_air_cooling.limit_reason: Power density and heat dissipation with consumer cooling

practical_limit_exotic_cooling.notes: Overclocking records, not practical for daily use

theoretical_silicon_limit.limit_reason: Electron mobility in silicon, RC delays, power density
theoretical_silicon_limit.notes: Would require revolutionary cooling and power delivery

alternative_materials.graphene: Potential 1 THz (1,000,000 MHz), but no practical transistors yet

rc_delay.impact: Becomes dominant at small feature sizes
rc_delay.notes: Limits clock frequency and requires sophisticated routing

electromigration.description: Metal atoms migrate under current, causing wire failure
electromigration.notes: Worse at higher temperatures, limits chip power density

crosstalk.impact: Requires spacing and shielding, reducing density
crosstalk.notes: Worse at smaller geometries and higher frequencies

moores_law.description: Moore's Law historical trends and current status

original_formulation_1965.metric: Component count at minimum cost per component
original_formulation_1965.author: Gordon Moore

revised_formulation_1975.notes: This became the commonly cited version, held approximately until ~2012

golden_age_1975_2005.notes: Dennard scaling: performance doubled with each generation

post_dennard_2005_2015.notes: Transistor density doubled, but clock speeds plateaued due to power

slowing_2015_2024.notes: Physical and economic barriers slowing progression

current_trend_2024.notes: Slowing significantly due to physical limits and economics
current_trend_2024.cost_per_transistor: No longer decreasing for leading-edge nodes

2025_2030.notes: Transition to 3D stacking and alternative scaling methods

dennard_scaling.description: Power density stays constant as transistors shrink
dennard_scaling.end_reason: Leakage current and voltage scaling limits
dennard_scaling.impact: End of 'free' performance gains, led to multi-core era
dennard_scaling.notes: This is what actually ended around 2005, not Moore's Law itself

dram_scaling.limit_reason: Minimum capacitance for reliable charge storage
dram_scaling.notes: DRAM scaling slower than logic due to capacitance requirements

sram_scaling.limit_reason: 6-transistor cell requires minimum area for stability
sram_scaling.notes: SRAM doesn't scale as well as logic. Cache size limited.

nand_flash_scaling.limit_reason: Aspect ratio and etching depth challenges

theoretical_electrical_limit.notes: Limited by electrical signaling physics. Optical interconnects needed beyond this.

capacity_per_chip.notes: Capacity limited by die cost and physics

storage_limits.description: Data storage density and endurance limits

theoretical_magnetic_limit.limit_reason: Superparamagnetic effect - grains too small become unstable
theoretical_magnetic_limit.notes: May require multi-actuator and new recording methods

solid_state_storage.notes: More bits per cell = lower endurance. Tradeoff between capacity and longevity.

optical_storage.notes: Limited by wavelength of light. Research into multi-layer and holographic storage.

dna_storage.longevity: Thousands of years if stored properly
dna_storage.practical_timeline: 2030s+ for niche archival use if ever

power_efficiency_limits.description: Fundamental and practical power efficiency limits

landauer_limit_detailed.formula: E = kT·ln(2), where k = Boltzmann constant
landauer_limit_detailed.description: Thermodynamic minimum energy for irreversible computation
landauer_limit_detailed.reversible_computing: Could theoretically avoid this limit, but extremely difficult in practice

mobile_soc_2024.notes: More efficient due to optimization for power

2030_target.notes: Requires advanced process nodes, new architectures

2040_optimistic.notes: Would require revolutionary advances in materials or architectures

communication_limits.description: Limits on data transmission and networking

fiber_optic_speed.notes: ~67% speed of light due to refractive index

practical_latencies.notes: Minimum latencies set by physics. Routing adds overhead.

theoretical_minimum_latency.notes: Direct fiber path at 67% speed of light. Never achievable due to routing.

current_single_mode.notes: Wavelength Division Multiplexing (WDM) uses multiple wavelengths

theoretical_shannon_limit.notes: Limited by Shannon capacity: C = B·log₂(1+SNR), depends on fiber properties and amplifiers

shannon_hartley.description: Maximum data rate given bandwidth and signal-to-noise ratio

spectrum_scarcity.high_frequency: More bandwidth, worse propagation, higher attenuation
spectrum_scarcity.mmwave_5g: 24-100 GHz, high capacity but very short range

practical_ranges.notes: Real-world performance highly dependent on environment

on_chip_bandwidth.notes: Between compute units within a chip

amdahls_law.description: Theoretical speedup limited by serial portion of code
amdahls_law.p_definition: P = fraction of code that can be parallelized

examples.notes: Even small serial fractions severely limit scaling

gustafsons_law.description: Scaled speedup when problem size increases with processors
gustafsons_law.advantage: More optimistic than Amdahl for large problems
gustafsons_law.notes: Assumes parallelizable work scales with processors

memory_bandwidth.issue: Multiple cores compete for memory access
memory_bandwidth.mitigation: Large caches, HBM, careful data placement

cache_coherence.scaling_limit: Practical limit ~100-1000 cores per coherence domain

synchronization.notes: Can dominate runtime for fine-grained parallelism

load_balancing.impact: Some cores idle while others work

limits.occupancy: Limited by register and shared memory per thread

data_limits.description: Limits on available training data and data growth

total_internet_text_2024.uncertainty: High - depends on what counts as 'accessible'
total_internet_text_2024.notes: Includes all web pages, but much is duplicate or low quality

estimated_frontier_model_usage.notes: Estimates vary widely. Models use filtered, high-quality subset.
estimated_frontier_model_usage.uncertainty: Very high - companies don't disclose exact training data

data_scarcity_timeline.implications: Need for synthetic data, data efficiency, multimodal training

image_text_pairs.notes: Limited by copyright, quality, and captioning

video_data.notes: Copyright and processing costs limit usage

concerns: Model collapse - degradation from training on synthetic data
synthetic_data.notes: Increasingly important as natural data plateaus

data_creation_rate.notes: Most new data is video, images, and IoT sensors - not all useful for AI training

cost_limits.description: Economic limits on technology scaling and model development

fab_cost_2024.notes: Cost of building a new advanced semiconductor fab

mask_set_cost.notes: Non-recurring engineering cost for chip design

wafer_cost.notes: Costs increasing per wafer even as yield improves

llm_training_costs.note: Estimates vary widely and are often speculative. Companies rarely disclose actual costs.

training_cost_ceiling.notes: May be pushed higher if models prove sufficiently valuable

inference_cost_trends.limit: Cannot drop below hardware + electricity costs

cooling_limits.description: Heat dissipation and thermal management limits

absolute_air_cooling.examples: Overclocked CPUs with extreme air cooling

aio_consumer.notes: All-in-one liquid coolers, common for high-end CPUs

two_phase.notes: Liquid evaporates and condenses, very efficient
two_phase.cost: Very expensive, used in HPC and crypto mining

practical_silicon.notes: Above this, thermal management becomes extremely difficult

hotspot_limit.notes: Local hot spots can exceed average, cause failures

thermal_interface.limit: Thermal interface material (TIM) resistance is significant bottleneck
thermal_interface.notes: Gap between die and heat spreader/cooler

temperature_limits.notes: Higher temps reduce lifespan and reliability significantly

human_perception_limits.description: Limits of human sensory perception for display and audio technology

angular_resolution.notes: Beyond this, individual pixels not distinguishable

retina_display.notes: Apple's marketing term, based on angular resolution

8k_overkill.notes: 8K provides no benefit for typical TV viewing distances (2-3x height)

refresh_rate.notes: Diminishing returns above 120Hz for most people

dynamic_range.notes: Humans can perceive very wide dynamic range, but not simultaneously

color_depth.notes: 10-bit sufficient for most, 8-bit shows banding in gradients

frequency_range.notes: High frequency hearing degrades with age

hydrogen_fuel_cell.notes: Storage tank and system weight reduces practical density

gasoline_energy.notes: Chemical energy in gasoline. Batteries unlikely to match.

thermodynamic_electrochemical.notes: Theoretical limit for electrochemical storage based on atomic masses

charging_limits.notes: Tradeoff between charging speed and battery longevity

current_systems_2024.notes: Qubit count alone doesn't determine capability

error_correction_threshold.notes: Need ~1 million physical qubits for useful error-corrected systems

photonic_computing.timeline: 2025-2030 for niche applications, 2035+ for broader adoption

current_chips.notes: Specialized for pattern recognition, sensory processing

neuromorphic_computing.timeline: 2025-2030 for edge AI, general adoption uncertain

dna_computing.timeline: Research curiosity, no practical computing timeline

metadata.uncertainty_note: Many values in this dataset are theoretical limits, projections, or estimates. Actual future development may differ significantly. Values marked as 'estimated' or with ranges have substantial uncertainty.
metadata.projection_caution: Technology projections beyond 5 years are highly speculative. Economic, geopolitical, and scientific factors can dramatically change trajectories.
metadata.sources: Based on physics principles, academic research, industry roadmaps (IRDS), and expert estimates. Specific sources should be consulted for critical applications.
metadata.alternative_computing_note: Most alternative computing paradigms are specialized for specific tasks and unlikely to replace general-purpose silicon computing in the foreseeable future.
metadata.cost_estimates: Cost estimates for AI training and chip fabrication vary widely and are often based on incomplete information. Treat as rough order-of-magnitude only.
